_header: Mary Mother of mercy and pity / And Saint Katherine pray for me
Subjects: prayers, to Virgin Mary, and saints; litanies; Virgin Mary, prayers to; saints, prayers to
Bibliographic Ghosts: Cambridge UK, Cambridge University Library Dd.8.2, f. 5: not verse, not even same first line.
_description: A Litany to the Virgin and numerous Saints — mainly in quatrains

Bod939.First Lines:
[M]Ary moder of mercy & pyteAnd seynt kateryn pray for
                    me…
Bod939.Last Lines:
…And for all quik and dedepater noster Aue and
                    Crede
Bod939.Note:
34 lines; couplets alternating with refrain, ‘Pray for me wyth owr
                    lady / That ihesu on me haue mercy’.
Bod939.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 190-1.
